direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the inner HTML of elements but at different positions (start vs. end).
Both methods insert HTML content relative to the element, but before operates on the outer HTML.
Both methods handle HTML strings and may throw exceptions if the input is invalid.
Both methods manipulate the HTML content of elements, though html replaces the entire content.
Both methods can change the state of the DOM by modifying elements.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing elements before modifying their content is a common setup step.
Validating HTML before prepending ensures the input is safe and well-formed.
Verifying the content after modification ensures the operation was successful.
